recipe.name: Beef and Mustard Pie
recipe.description: A hearty British pie featuring tender beef cooked in a rich mustard and red wine sauce, encased in a flaky puff pastry crust.
steps: In a bowl, toss the diced beef with plain flour, salt, and black pepper.
Heat a large casserole over medium-high heat. Add half of the rapeseed oil and brown the beef in batches, ensuring not to overcrowd the pan. Remove and set aside each batch once browned.
Once all the beef is browned, return it to the pan. Pour in the red wine and cook until reduced by half.
Add the beef stock, sliced onion, chopped carrots, thyme sprigs, and mustard. Season with additional salt and black pepper as needed.
Cover the casserole with a lid and place it in the preheated oven. Cook for approximately 2 hours, or until the beef is tender.
Remove from the oven, discard the thyme sprigs, and allow the mixture to cool.
Transfer the cooled beef mixture into a pie dish. Brush the rim of the dish with beaten egg yolk.
Roll out the puff pastry and place it over the filling, pressing the edges to seal. Trim any excess pastry.
Brush the top of the pastry with more beaten egg yolk.
Bake in the oven for 30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot, optionally accompanied by green beans or other vegetables.
Enjoy your dish, and remember: great food is made with love!
